products.name: Carbon Resistors
products.description: Carbon resistors are widely used in electronic circuits for general resistance needs. They offer a cost-effective solution and are known for their long-term stability and reliable performance.

products.name: Current Sense Resistors
products.description: Current sense resistors are precision components used to measure electrical current by detecting voltage drops. Essential for power monitoring and circuit protection systems.

products.name: Metal Film Resistor
products.description: Metal film resistors are known for their accuracy and stability. They provide precise resistance values and are suitable for high-frequency or low-noise applications.

products.name: Metal Oxide Resistors
products.description: Metal oxide resistors are used in environments with high temperatures and electrical surges. Their flame-resistant coating makes them ideal for safety-critical designs.

products.name: Resistor Networks & Arr.
products.description: Resistor networks or arrays integrate multiple resistors into a single package. They simplify circuit design and are widely used in digital logic systems and pull-up configurations.

products.name: Thermistor
products.description: Thermistors are resistors that vary resistance based on temperature. Commonly used in temperature sensing, control, and compensation applications in electronic devices.

products.name: Varistor
products.description: Varistors protect circuits from voltage spikes and surges. They are widely used in power supplies, consumer electronics, and industrial equipment for overvoltage protection.

products.name: Wirewound Resistors
products.description: Wirewound resistors are known for their high power handling and precision. Ideal for high current circuits, power supplies, and load testing applications.

products.name: Resistors Kit
products.description: The resistor kit includes a wide variety of resistance values, making it perfect for prototyping, education, and lab use. Conveniently organized and labeled for easy access.

products.name: Light Dependent (LDR)
products.description: LDRs change resistance based on light intensity and are widely used in light-detection applications such as automatic lights, solar garden lights, and alarm systems.
